comment: This was for an Honors discovery class, so not quite like a normal class. We only had one piece of graded work and it was an easy A. You could decide if you wanted to do a group project or not. Mostly discussion based class. Dr. Singleton was very kind.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The professor was always late to class, late to grade papers/tests/quizzes, and late to our service learning project. There was a reading like every week or every other week. Her quizzes are so specific and she grades them harshly. However, she's pretty easy when grading papers/tests. She's an okay professor but if you can try to take someone else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: If you have to take her thats fine but try to get a someone else The quizzes are crazy specific says the test is short response but its really a 500 word paper and part of your grade is doing service work outside of class time so hope you didn't have plans cause you'll need to move them to pass the class. And the readings are not easy to understand
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She was a great professor for honors 1100. It was mostly us talking and expanding on the pillars of honors college. Grades easily but her D2L was a little confusing, so make sure you make reminders for assignments. Your peer mentor will be a very helpful resource. I am taking her again for an Honors discovery course and I'm not mad about it.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Singleton was a very engaging professor. Her class was interesting and I always found myself tuned in when she was lecturing. The course was helpful and I enjoyed the work. She is very inconsistent with the timing of grades. Expect to get your big assignments back at least 2 weeks after she originally says. Grades heavy on grammar.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Respected

comment: She was really nice.
rating_tags: Caring--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: She's Nice. Good professor. I just feel like she makes the class harder than it needs to be
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: HON1100 is an easy class. Dr. Singleton has clear grading criteria and has great lectures. She is very nice and understanding, and as long as you do the work, you should get an A.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: she is super nice, i did not enjoy the class itself but it was mandatory for honors. lots of reading prompts and worksheets for homework, but the class itself is just discussion based and is mostly student-led so not too hard. just kinda boring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Respected

comment: Singleton's class was semi hard because you have to read and understand the material in order to participate in class, which is expected. Some of the bigger assignments didn't have many parameters, which made it difficult, and most writing assignments weren't graded until near the end of the semester. It's clear she understands what shes teaching.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: So many writing assignments all for this one super long paper that takes the whole semester. Each part of it is super hard and takes forever. She never grades anything and you also have to buy two textbooks that you don't use. Would definitely not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: The class mainly consists of group discussions, reading prompts, event attendance, and a final project. Participation is very important. She doesn't put in grades until the semester is almost over and usually does not respond to emails in a timely manner. Overall an OK class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Attendance was an important part of our grade. We had weekly readings assigned, provided online by the prof. She uses powerpoints as well as group discussions in class. No tests or final, two projects, and a paper. She makes rubrics for all assignments, following them can easily get you an A/100%. This class is an easy A as long as you try.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Not a hard class at all. Consisted of mainly in-class discussions and a few easy papers. Attendance is extremely important and counts towards your final grade. She takes a while to grade papers and you probably won't receive them until the end of the semester. Simply show up and do your assignments and you should be golden.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Participation matters

comment: Professor Singleton is a very easy grader- and she promotes class discussions and offered everyone a chance to engage in academic discussions. She is easy to talk to and work with.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Caring--Clear grading criteria

comment: Class can be very difficult. For some of her quizzes, you basically had to memorize whatever material was assigned to you in order to pass. Got a lot of 50's. There are some easy A's though such as a participation grade for speaking up in class. Overall, okayish professor. Would recommend for some but not all.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Professor Singleton runs her class in a Socratic seminar setup. She asks us what we thought about the reading and allows us to drive the discussion. We only had two papers throughout the entire semester which she grades thoroughly, but should not be too difficult if you do not procrastinate. She is super understanding and patient.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Caring

comment: This class is very easy to pass. It is a few discussions and a few readings with some reflection papers sprinkled in.

Dr. Singleton is a wonderful professor. She isn't a push over professor by any means; however, her grading is more than fair. She gives quizzes that can be hard, but as long as you read, they're easy A/Bs. The first unit is a learning curve as to what she expects out of you, but as long as you put in the effort, you will get the grade you deserve.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: I had her for a HON course, but even with that course, you can see that she is very harsh when it comes to grading for her English classes. The papers we did have did receive good feedback, however. Luckily, our course was more discussion-based. But I would think twice if I actually had to take her for an English course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I took the honors introduction course during covid, but Prof Singleton was super cool. The class is discussion heavy and requires you to be involved. She is very lienient with grading and is easy to get in contact with.
Just choose a different teacher for the sake of your sanity
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The teacher is really nice and understanding. You will be given weekly readings and content that can be found online with a worksheet to complete based on the content. There are some papers and projects. Going to class was a grade due to Corona. No way to not get an A if you are putting forth effort.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Caring

comment: This is probably one of the hardest classes I have ever taken, but Dr. Singleton is an amazing teacher and wants you to do well. In the honors section of this course, our final research paper was 12 pages long which was extremely difficult but the satisfaction after the course is over is very much worth it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: This class was extremely tough. Very strict with formatting. I got -25 points for minor formatting issues. 10-12 page research paper with recent sources, very difficult. Read books and take quizzes even while working on other assignments. She is very responsive and is helpful when asked for. Try to avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I took her class my first semester, and she's a pretty hard grader, but it helped me in other class. There's a lot of interesting discussions, and she is easy to access. If you are making a point in class discussions, she'll challenge you to make sure you can defend it well. The discussions really helped me become a better writer for the essays.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: We had good discussions on interesting topics and she's really nice. Work load wasn't too bad. 2 essays (outlines and drafts for both), 3 quizzes, an essay midterm, and a presentation. Grades hard on essays. Only con was that she took forever to grade essays. Did not get grades until last week of class which was stressful. I got an A though.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: As my first English professor I didn't think she was bad, but most definitely could've been better.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Singleton was my first English professor in college and she was awful. She is very harsh and opinionated. We had a few discussion posts aside from papers and I completely forgot about one on a day I had a lot of things going on and I tried to ask her if I could make it up and she wouldn't let me which is why I finished with an 89.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES
